intro: Agelaea ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda agelaea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its attractive, small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
